Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module A
Section 2: Recognizing & Reporting Child Abuse, Neglect, & Maltreatment

ADDITIONAL REPORTING INFORMATION

Here are some additional bits of information regarding reporting.

  • 24/7
  • Gather All Details
  • Make Report Away From Child
  • Make Multiple Reports
  • Rejected Complaints
  • Mandated Report Actions
  • Other Info

24/7

Centralized Intake is open 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

Gather All Details

Provide as many details as you can in your report. If you know it, include the name and address of the parent, names, birthdates, race, and identifying information of all members of the household. Note whether the alleged perpetrator lives in the house or has current access to the child. Provide the address where the incident occurred, statements of child’s disclosure, history of child’s behavior, and why abuse/neglect is suspected.

Make Report Away From Child

Do not call in your report when the child is present. This could add additional trauma to the child and remove your ability to be a confidential reporter.

Make Multiple Reports

If you have had multiple concerns, make sure to submit an additional report with each incident.

Rejected Complaints

Don’t feel your complaint was not taken seriously if it is rejected. It could mean that there is already an investigation, and CPS can not tell you due to confidentiality.

Mandated Report Actions

There are a number of actions CPS can take when investigating a complaint. At times, they are not substantiated because other reports have been taken. Those made by mandated reporters are substantiated at twice the rate of non-mandated reporters.

Other Info

Also, please be aware that CPS is not authorized to investigate complaints solely on head lice, missed therapy, school truancy, and certain medical issues like immunizations and not giving psychotropic meds, like those for Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder. (See the Mandated Reporter Manual in the Support Material section, pg. 11 for details.)
